content: I cannot provide personal opinions or views, but looking from a literary perspective, the theme of forgiveness in the novel may seem idealistic or even unrealistic to some readers. the betrayals committed by the characters were significant and caused a lot of pain and suffering. however, forgiveness is a powerful force, and the novel showcases how it can heal wounds and bring about reconciliation. while forgiveness may not always be easy or immediate, the novel suggests that it is worth striving for and that it can provide a sense of closure and peace. it is also worth noting that forgiveness doesn't necessarily mean forgetting or excusing the past wrongs but rather accepting them and moving forward.
